definition: north China navy (esp. the ill-fated Chinese navy in the 1895 war with Japan)
north/(classical) to be defeated
ocean/vast/foreign/silver dollar or coin
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
teacher/master/expert/model/army division/(old) troops/to dispatch troops
surname Shi

sentences.english: Naval port in northern China, the Qing northern naval base.
sentences.chinese: 中国北方军港，清朝北洋水师基地。

sentences.english: Beiyang Navy is the earliest naval force of China.
sentences.chinese: 北洋水师是中国最早的海军部队。

sentences.english: This was the Northern Navy commander's office, or commonly known as the Navy Yamen.
sentences.chinese: 这儿就是当年的北洋水师提督署，俗称水师衙门。

sentences.english: The Northern Navy made Chinese people at the time feel extremely proud.
sentences.chinese: 北洋水师让当时的中国人感到无比自豪。

north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
ironclad/an armor-plated battleship
the Qing Dynasty name for the coastal provinces of Liaoning, Hebei, and Shandong
the Qing court (as government of China)
